sub_title: Growth & Creative Consultant for brands with integrity • Ethical Marketing & Conversion Copywriting Geek •Community host @ The Ethical Move
summary:
We need a culture change. 

Because to stop climate change, save species from dying and make society more humane, we need a radical rethink.

Communication is at the core of that change. It's the medium and the message of the change you want to see in the world.

- If we want to make sustainability the norm, we need more sustainable communication.
- If we want people to take more responsibility, we need more responsible communication.
- If we want to break down the barriers that keep us from working together, we need communication that connects us.

That’s why I started From Scratch — to support organisations in their transformation towards integrating economic, social and environmental impact.

✍️ 🤙 🧑‍🏫 ⌨️ 💬 📧 🧑‍💻

👉My professional journey before starting from scratch👈

🏫 You could say I’ve been writing copy since 1997, when I made ads to get pupils joining political groups and fighting for better education.

🧱15 years later, I started the global copy team at LEGO Customer Service. The tone of voice, copywriting and advisor training we created made some LEGO customer service emails go viral — such as the one that went out to Luka Apps. Proof that customer service is a marketing function.

✏️ I then spent a few years agency-side, writing web copy, voice scripts, chat and email messages for over 70 iconic brands. 

📖 Ever wished people came with manuals? Here’s mine: shrtco.de/SabinesManual

❓🎙 What change do you want to make? Let's chat: https://from-scratch.net/contact or words@from-scratch.net

awards.title: Consumer Champion Award
awards.description: I'm proud and honoured to have received the first ever Consumer Champion Award for always putting the consumer/user first.

projects.title: Bricks & Pieces Online Payment
projects.description:
Leading the consumer communications work stream of this multi-team project, I was responsible for making sure all auto-notifications for consumers in 17 languages were created or updated and provided all copy for the purchase flow, including Terms & Conditions in easy-to-understand English, German and French. 
Another responsibility was change management for long-standing customers to help them understand the changes.
I also acted as subject matter expert for the European and North American contact centres, supporting training with Q&A sessions and information shared via the Advisor knowledge base.

projects.title: Global Consumer Service Knowledge Base ("RefGuide")
projects.description: Created project plan, user experience and information architecture for a new global internal, wiki-based knowledge base for Consumer Service. Drove research, user involvement, usability testing, change management and training of contributors.

contributors.headline: Growth & Creative Consultant for brands with integrity • Ethical Marketing & Conversion Copywriting Geek •Community host @ The Ethical Move

projects.title: Contact Us
projects.description:
The experience of emailing LEGO Consumer Service should represent all that we stand for as a brand. And in most cases, users should be able to help themselves. The new form allows users to find the correct answer or shows them where they can go to self-serve, and it makes filling in a form a little more fun.
Email is the most popular way to get in touch with the service team, so the contact us page promotes email while keeping all necessary contact information for phone and snail mail easily accessible.

projects.title: Customer Service FAQs Revamp
projects.description:
We're giving our FAQ section a pre-autumn clean - resetting our focus on the most frequently asked questions, rewriting every single item from scratch, localising them for our key markets and moving them into a new content management system. 
This move goes hand in hand with a redesign that will make this section look much more appealing and make it easier to use.

profile_positions.description:
Know Your Message — Share Your Message — Live Your Message

We help organisations achieve ultimate clarity so they can be the change they want to see in the world: through 

- Strategy and communications consulting
- Defining ‘what excellence looks like’ and helping to foster a culture of continuous improvement
- Multilingual conversion copywriting
- Narrative user experience — shaping interfaces such as 'contact us' flows, forms and self-service apps
- Templates and model responses for any channel, from outbound letters to email responses, chat and social media
- Touch point audits
- Conversion coaching
- Storytelling workshops
- Transcreation of marketing materials for foreign markets
- Transformative masterminds for teams, managers and lead specialists

As a team, we harness the best that the humanities have to offer — from design thinking and UX practices to ecolinguistics, from psychology to socio-political studies.

With our diverse backgrounds and perspectives, we're uniquely qualified to help you define — or refine — your internal and external communication. 

Work with us and you'll get a team who understands purpose-driven, conversion-focused B2B and B2C marketplaces. 
A team that understands what makes your ideal customers tick, both from personal experience and through research.
A team that speaks your language(s) — or brings someone along who does.

Past & current clients include:
- 5-star superior Hotel Bareiss, Germany
- Dutch Harvest, Netherlands
- Ethical Brand Marketing, Germany
- #Ethical Hour, UK
- Fair Wear Foundation, Netherlands
- Sky UK
- Support Driven, USA
- Renée Lertzman, USA
- On AG, Switzerland
- klicksafe, Germany
- dogado group, Germany
- AbacusBio, New Zealand
- Brand the Change, Kenya
profile_positions.title: UX-Centred Communications & Ethical Marketing Consultant | Founder, Chief Growth & Creative Officer

profile_positions.description: Leader of the Mages Guild; practicing and teaching the arcane arts. Specialties: Alchemy, Destruction
profile_positions.title: Archmage

profile_positions.description:
Companies I wrote for, consulted or trained include

Third sector:
- National Trust
- Rainbow Trust

Retail:
- Fortnum & Mason
- John Lewis
- Next

Entertainment and Telecommunications:
- Sky
- TalkTalk
- Virgin Media

Travel:
- Interval International
- Royal Caribbean

Utilities:
- Dee Valley Water
- npower

Financial Services and Insurance:
- AXA Self Investor
- Direct Line
- Hiscox


My key responsibilities:

-	Strategy, planning, development and delivery of service communications.
-	Developing new written communications products and services. 
-	Researching new ideas and concepts that can become embedded into our future services.
-	Delivering communications training — both general drop-in courses and tailored workshops. 
-	Building positive and collaborative relationships with customers and the rest of the team. 
-	Coming up with ideas, creativity and communications that inspire our clients and meet their needs. 
-	Project management, managing colleagues and external resources (local or remote).  
-	Getting client buy-in on our concepts, ideas and outputs.
-	Delivering excellence and meeting tight timelines. Every day.
profile_positions.title: Service Communications Manager

profile_positions.description:
- I owned the written voice of global Consumer Service in 20 languages across Europe, North America and Asia
- As editorial lead, I looked after one other in house writer, a global team of proofreaders and external localisation partners.
- Crisis management was my special superpower — I handled the most sensitive complaints
- As the UX lead for the Consumer Service knowledge base, I led the team that revamped all the content and redesigned the wiki in Microsoft Sharepoint.
- Finally, I was responsible for the narrative part of the UX on LEGO.com/service - including processes, flows, content creation, self-service management, analytics, value optimization
profile_positions.title: Consumer Service Editor and Copy Writer

profile_positions.description:
I wrote copy for LEGO.com/service and offline communication with LEGO builders, maintained the internal knowledge base and helped with training and change management.
In addition, I was the contact centre's contact person for the Central European marketing office in Munich.
profile_positions.title: Consumer Services Editorial Administrator

profile_positions.description:
I responded to LEGO builders' calls, emails and letters, always putting their needs first and applying all my knowledge and imagination to solve their queries.
In addition, I analysed and presented post-purchase survey results to the team in charge of the Direct sales channels, and acted as contact person for international LEGO Club enquiries at Consumer Services.
profile_positions.title: Consumer Service Advisor (German, English)

profile_positions.description:
I taught groups of up to 32 girls between the ages of 10 and 21 in German, English and interdisciplinary studies (Project Work). School trips were also part of my daily work — from planning the details to waiting with the last child until she's picked up on our return.
I also coordinated interdisciplinary teaching across the school.
profile_positions.title: Teacher (German, English)

profile_positions.description:
I diagnosed students' learning needs, developed customised courses (short and long term), documented and evaluated their progress and results. Students came from all age groups, from primary school to adult learners. I worked one-on-one and with small groups of up to 5. As success and happiness go hand in hand, I also helped manage conflicts between students, parents and teachers.

I helped stock our library of books and educational games, either buying or creating materials that worked for our students. When we got an interactive whiteboard, I trained my colleagues on how to use it.

- Subjects: German (also as a foreign language), English, French, Latin, Maths, Learning Strategies & Techniques, Concentration; special courses for AD(H)D, dyslexic students and students with special needs/learning difficulties
profile_positions.title: Private Tutor

profile_positions.description:
- Development of courses at short notice for students aged 10-19 across all levels of ability and all school subjects, except Catholic R.E. and P.E.
- Teacher with full responsibilities including class teacher duties
- Differentiated teaching and individualised learning
- Mediation - this school saw a lot of behavioural problems with less academically minded students
profile_positions.title: Supply Teacher (Comprehensive Secondary School)

profile_positions.description: Proofed and edited Martin Büsser's German translation of John Robb's Punk Rock.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Proofreader & Translation Editor

profile_positions.description:
Activities and responsibilities included:

- Final proofreading and editing
- Assessment of manuscripts
- Type and layout corrections in QuarkXPress
- Data updates at VLB (publishers’ database) and Amazon
- Research (online and offline)
- Communications management (press releases, reviews, catalogues)

Topics: musical history (pop/rock/punk), film, cultural studies
profile_positions.title: Proofreader and Editor (Intern)

profile_positions.description: I taught a group of bilingual children aged 2-5 every Saturday morning. We sang songs, read stories, played games, had the messiest craft sessions creating beautiful things (some of which I still have) and made friends. The main thing was allowing the children to practise speaking German with each other and keep their cultural heritage relevant in their social interactions with others of the same age.
profile_positions.title: Kindergarten Teacher

volunteer_experiences.description: Copy and messaging advice for this incredible NGO that teaches English to asylum seekers and refugees in Utrecht.
As part of the training team, I dreamt up new ways to create a great experience for our members around the world. I also looked after our new members' experience so they felt at home from day one.
